intro: Tricoryne elatior var. decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive tricoryne, is a rare and striking member of the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its unique foliage, featuring elongated, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are often overlooked due to their subtle appearance. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its common name, "deceptive tricoryne," refers to its ability to mimic other plants, making it difficult to identify without close examination.
